thread.title: Macauley FG gives N.C. Central 20-17 win over Morgan State
thread.title_full: Macauley FG gives N.C. Central 20-17 win over Morgan State

title: Macauley FG gives N.C. Central 20-17 win over Morgan State
text:
Macauley FG gives N.C. Central 20-17 win over Morgan State 
Posted 5:35 p.m. yesterday Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this 
DURHAM, N.C. â€” Nigel Macauley booted a 30-yard field goal after a fumble recovery in the fourth quarter to give North Carolina Central a 20-17 victory over Morgan State on Saturday. 
Morgan State's punter Chris Moller fumbled a low snap that Ramone Simpson recovered at the Morgan State 19 with 7:41 remaining. The Bears held and Macauley booted the field goal for the win. 
The Bears drove to the NCCU 16 on the next series but were stopped when Ryan Smith intercepted a Seth Higgins' pass with 2:48 remaining. 
Dorrel McClain, who finished with 113 rushing yards, scored two touchdowns to give North Carolina Central (4-3, 3-1 Mid-Eastern Athletic) a 14-0 lead in the first quarter. 
Higgins, who finished with 226 yards passing, ran for one score and passed to Willie Gillus III for another as Morgan State (3-4, 3-2) charged back to tie at 14 with 10:17 left in the third.
